text: hi everyone
Anthony Fantana here the internet
sleepiest music nerd and it's time for a
sleepy little review of the new Autechre
LP x i Autechre is an electronic music
duo hailing from the UK who for decades
have been creating everything from
experimental techno to IDM glitch music
and through the many full-length albums
that shaun booth and Rob Brown have
produced together over the years they
have proven themselves to be extremely
extremely creative and explorative
personalities when it comes to the world
of sound and sound manipulation and that
applies both to percussion just the
Tambor's the textures that these guys
put together in their beats along with
synthesizers which typically have a
pretty phat analogue sound to them when
Autechre is putting synth chords and
melodies together and the way that these
guys manipulate synthesizer sounds it's
really somewhat of a lost art in my
opinion something that was much more
prevalent back in the 90s when a lot of
people perceive Autechre to have been
having their their musical heyday but
what I feel that makes Autechre
different than many other artists that
are on a similar sonic journey is that
their search for sounds their
exploration for sounds tends to be
extremely extremely methodical sort of
like a chemist looking for the perfect
amount of the right element to create
the just right right right Chain
Reaction for some kind of extremely
complicated equation now the sounds and
the textures that Autechre works with
have evolved over the years sometimes
deciding the overall path of entire
full-length albums especially like a few
of their most recent coarseness and
oversteps both of which had a much more
ambient and experimental feel to them in
comparison to some of the more beat
oriented work these two LPs also combine
elements of glitch and IDM which
typically show up in Autechre x' music
but
no matter how little or how greatly
these guys change on a given full-length
one thing kind of remains the same it
remains constant and that is the
emotional quality of their music rarely
is aught ecers music very visceral or
visceral in the way that we typically
see visceral music it doesn't get your
blood pumping it doesn't get you
thrashing about like a punk song would
or you know really hard hip-hop beat
would or a metal song would or like a
dubstep song or even a traditional
techno song instead Autechre shoot for
something that is much more cerebral
much more thought-provoking something
that is going to attract extremely
analytical listeners like flies to a
dead corpse
and those extremely analytical listeners
may be very pleased by the challenge
that Autechre presents to them on this
new LP which is two discs and two hours
long
I'm sure hardcore fans will completely
soak this album up but Excise is not for
your casual or maybe even first-time
Autechre listener possibly for the most
part Autechre is sticking to a lot of
the same genre confines that people
place them into the glitch the IDM the
experimental or avant-garde techno a
touch of ambient music - they constantly
look for new and different sounds to
engage the listener with on one track
after another through this 17 song
affair however there's not an immense
amount of emotional variation throughout
this LP there are some tracks that stand
out past others in the fact that they
may feel a little bit sweeter through
some synthesizer chords others like the
opener on here have a bit of a drum and
bass influence I feel but the drums that
would be no typically being a drum and
bass song are replaced with noisy sharp
glitches and Autechre presents slower
moments as well like the clothes are on
this album which feels like to an extent
kind of a synth Odyssey still that
doesn't stop this LP from kind of
feeling like an overnight cram session
and that's because even in its most
upbeat and intense moments ex I really
only kind of gets my head bobbing
moderately the
stimulation that the album brings to me
is much more of a inside of my head my
brain just really starts kind of firing
off electricity in many different
directions because of all the sounds
that they hit me with and the array of
sounds the Autechre bring to the table
does make this LP pretty ambitious it's
also ambitious from a length perspective
although I think some people could
charge this album is not really being
that outside the box for Autechre in
terms of just the way their music feels
it's still very cold it's still very
kind of scientific and because of that
does become sort of difficult to say
what is a highlight on this album and
what is it there there are tracks on
here like IR light which are 10 minutes
a song that Autechre presents right at
the second track of this LP and this
song with a handful of others man these
guys are presenting these 10 or 12
minute monoliths something that they
kind of gravitated away from on some of
their more recent releases and I'm
actually happy to see them return to
this style because they really know how
to develop a track and make it
interesting from beginning to end but
still always kind of remaining very
abstract and kind of chilly that's not
to say that Autec errs music doesn't
have humanity to it it most definitely
does there are patterns that are
pleasing and easy to get into there are
clear chord progressions that do have
sort of a logical progression to them
however there are other tracks on here
like prac F for example which when it
comes to grooves or patterns or anything
like that feel incredibly irregular the
beat on this track feels like it almost
skips a beat and the way it moves it's
this track and maybe a few others like
it on here where I feel like I'm hearing
maybe three to four different elements
of beat maybe a few different
synthesizer phrases and it feels like
the only thing they truly have in common
is a tempo and that's about it and as I
listen through to this LP again and
again and again I sort of began to see a
little bit more of a pattern between
some of these tracks where maybe some of
the synthesizer melodies or the beats
backing the synthesizers seem a little
bit random I guess another standout on
here is the song tes X I which to me has
kind of a tropical flavor to the
synthesizers
sort of reminding me of that loan album
that I dug so much last year it's really
kind of got this Caribbean feel to it
but eventually the track gets kind of
dark sort of murky submerging itself
back into the ocean where it came truly
where this album finds its magic is in
the variety of sounds and flavors and
speeds and intensities that it brings to
the table like I already said I feel
like I'm repeating myself again but I
have to bring this point home that this
is what makes this album appealing
though on the whole it's not anything
altogether new for Autechre it's still
coming from that same emotional place
where I feel like this album reaches a
new maybe a subtly new and higher level
of awesomeness is in just how freakin
detailed it is because of how cold that
this album can feel some people may sort
of tune it out just in general because
it doesn't really bring the attitudes or
the emotions that people typically look
for in music anger happiness sadness
love maybe a little bit of lust this
album has little to none of those things
however that's not to say that it's not
beautiful or inspiring or extremely
proficient from a technical standpoint
and well produced really it's it's all
of those things I can't help but stand
in awe of just its vastness of its
expansiveness the amount of electronic
nooks and crannies that have been placed
throughout this LP can be listened to
and observed for months upon months and
still not be fully appreciated or
understood and in my opinion that's
actually a pretty fantastic feat it's
like this never-ending puzzle it brings
this constant sense of intrigue to the
listener all of these things add up into
what I feel has been one of the more
unique experiences I've had with
electronic music over the past half a
year or so I'm feeling a decent too
strong eight on this LP
listen what did you think of it did you
love it did you hate it why what do you
think I should review next and yeah
that's about it
pucker X I forever
